COURSES.name: Teaching Art: the Study of Practice
COURSES.description: Studies art-teaching practices in the public schools. Emphasizes art curriculum, planning, art instructional strategies, art room management and methods of evaluation in art.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior-level art education major.

sections.note: This section meets AUG 22 UNTIL OCT 10   These dates may not include final examinations.

COURSES.name: Principles of Teaching Art
COURSES.description: Investigates the contemporary issues in art, education and society that impact teaching art in public schools. Theoretical perspectives and practical strategies are explored for developing content and teaching approaches. (H) (WR)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior-level art education major.

sections.note: This section meets OCT 10 UNTIL DEC 05   These dates may not include final examinations.

COURSES.name: Art Education for Elementary Schools
COURSES.description: Helps the preparing classroom teacher develop a basic knowledge of art and the teaching of art at the elementary level.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: second-semester standing in the elementary ProTeach program; Coreq: ProTeach field experience in the fall and spring semesters.

COURSES.name: Art Appreciation: American Diversity and Global Arts
COURSES.description: Introduces the visual arts from a global perspective with an emphasis on diversity in the United States. (H and D)

COURSES.name: Introduction to the Principles and History of Art 1
COURSES.description: Principles of art and relation of styles to cultural context. Introductory study of art and architecture from ancient times to the end of the Middle Ages. (H and N)

COURSES.name: Introduction to the Principles and History of Art 2
COURSES.description: Continuation of ARH 2050. Art and architecture from the Renaissance to the present. (H and N)

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Art History
COURSES.description: Special topics in art history. (H)

COURSES.name: Etruscan and Roman Art
COURSES.description: The art and architecture of the Italian peninsula from the Etruscan period through the Roman Empire. (H and N)
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ARH 2050 or CLA 3700, and art major or art history minor.

COURSES.name: Global Baroque Art
COURSES.description: Studies Baroque and Rococo art from a global perspective, considering how and why the style appeared in so many regions (even those with no Roman and/or Renaissance heritage) and what its distinct meanings were. Also examines the origins of the concepts of the Baroque and Rococo.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ARH 2050 or ARH 2051.

COURSES.name: Art in the Age of Revolution
COURSES.description: Topics in the late 18th and early 19th century European art, including Neo-Classicism and Romanticism. Works of art are considered in the cultural, political, social and aesthetic contexts in which they were made. Emphasizes the politics of style during this period of revolution and resection. (H) (WR)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ARH 2051 or art major or art history minor.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Art History
COURSES.description: Rotating special topics in art history.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1 to 3; can be repeated with change in content. Prereq: ARH 2050 or ARH 2051, and art major or art history minor.

COURSES.name: Internship
COURSES.description: Supervised practical experience with an art, graphic design or museum facility according to an approved program. Special seminar and evaluation sessions with faculty advisor and art facility manager. (S-U)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: arrangement with art advisor and chair and dean permission.

COURSES.name: Non-Major Photography: Imaging Society, Culture and Diversity in America
COURSES.description: In this course for non-majors, students use photographs they make to spur discussions about how photography shapes U.S. culture, diversity, and history. Through hands-on projects, critical readings, online lectures, quizzes and small-group discussions, students develop skills to create and understand engaging and conceptually rich photography.

COURSES.name: Workshop for Art Research and Practice: WARP
COURSES.description: Interdisciplinary, team-taught introductory course pairing studio experiences in a wide variety of media with introduction to concepts, theories and practices in contemporary art. In-depth exploration of creative processes, artistic integrity and the nature of artistic meaning.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 6; Prereq: art major, art education major, visual art studies major or graphic design major.

COURSES.name: Perceptual Drawing
COURSES.description: Introduces descriptive drawing. Basic theories of observation and depiction including perspective and chiaroscuro.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Drawing: Movement and Motion
COURSES.description: Introduces the principles of visual movement in 2D art as well as the depiction of figurative gesture in drawing.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 2305C.

COURSES.name: Printmaking: Color Theory
COURSES.description: Basic monoprint technique, methods and materials. Color theory as applied to printmaking and other art media.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Printmaking: Figure Ground
COURSES.description: Explores figure ground theory as related to 2D visual design and picture making. Basic skills in relief printing and Linocut-woodcut.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Painting: Investigations in Color
COURSES.description: Investigates color interaction and its role in pictorial composition. Exploration of color and light as well as the expressive use of color in painting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Painting from Observation
COURSES.description: Exercises and projects in seeing and painting. Emphasis on depicting of form, space and light.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Net Art
COURSES.description: Explores practical and theoretical issues related to the Internet as a medium for making art rather than as a tool for delivering information. Emphasizes the creation of dynamic and interactive experiences on the web that integrate video, graphics, animation, sound, image, and typography.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: art/history or graphic design major within the School of Art and Art History with a major code of ART, GRD, EAR, HYA, or VAS.

COURSES.name: Sculpture: Shaping Form and Space
COURSES.description: Investigates the co-shaping of form and space in full three dimensions. Emphasis on additive and subtractive processes.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Ceramics for Non-Majors
COURSES.description: A studio based introductory course that teaches ceramic art through techniques of handforming.

COURSES.name: Throwing: Skills and Concepts
COURSES.description: Introduces wheel throwing, pottery from, functional design and aesthetics.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 2757C.

COURSES.name: Ceramics: 3D Concepts
COURSES.description: Introduces three-dimensional form and design concepts using fired clay; includes hand-forming techniques, an introduction to glazing (fired color) and electric kiln firing.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 1803C.

COURSES.name: Ceramics for Non-Majors: Wheel Throwing
COURSES.description: Introduces the making of functional vessels on the potters wheel as expressive art. Focuses on throwing skills and three-dimensional design concepts related to the functional ceramic vessel and creative problem-solving. Provided technical information supports an understanding of forming, surfacing, glazing, and firing.

COURSES.name: Rotating Topics in Drawing for Non-Art Majors
COURSES.description: Students will use dynamic drawing techniques and approaches to explore contemporary art and connections across disciplines.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; can be repeated with change in content up to 9 credits. Prereq: non-art, non-art history majors only.

COURSES.name: Thematic Projects in Drawing
COURSES.description: Intermediate-level emphasis of conceptual strategies and image construction through the lens of themes in film, literature, and art using color drawing media.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: Junior level ART, GRD, EAR, CPH, or VAS major.

COURSES.name: Sketch Journal: Uses and Development
COURSES.description: Historic and contemporary uses of sketch journals. Exploration of notation, studies, invention and conceptualization in sketchbook drawing techniques.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2305C, ART 2374C and junior-level art major.

COURSES.name: Screen Printing
COURSES.description: Explores screen printing techniques utilizing drawn and photo-generated stencil processes.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2401C, ART 2468C and junior-level art major.

COURSES.name: Figure Painting
COURSES.description: The human figure serves as a formal and expressive motif as well as a departure point for creating individual painting statements.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: two of three from ART 2500C, ART 2501C and ART 2503C, and junior-level art major.

COURSES.name: Sculpture: Concepts and Strategies
COURSES.description: Continues ART 3701C. Emphasizes sculptural materials such as mixed media, metal fabrication, and casting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2701C or ART 2702C, and junior-level art major.

COURSES.name: Ceramic Sculpture 1
COURSES.description: Investigates the intermediate level of technical, conceptual and aesthetic issues involved with sculpting using ceramic materials. Students will learn to use sculptural form to convey ideas based on contemporary culture. Projects focus on the use of low-fire materials, image development and glaze electric fired to enhance sculpture.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 2757C.

COURSES.name: Interdisciplinary Studio
COURSES.description: Critical thinking, problem solving, and creative activity in collaboration and cross media art-making.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior-level art major.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Studio Art for Non-Art Majors
COURSES.description: Rotating topics in studio art and studio practice for juniors and seniors not majoring in art. This course cannot count toward any major within the School of Art and Art History.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior or senior level.

COURSES.name: Video Art
COURSES.description: Explores video with an emphasis on editing and building a personal vocabulary through the electronic image.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3. Prereq: DIG 2131C, DIG 2282C and junior-level digital media major.

COURSES.name: Advanced Drawing
COURSES.description: Emphasizes individual and creative expression.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3 to 6; can be repeated with change in content; Prereq: ART 3310C, ART 3330C, ART 3380C and ART 3381C.

COURSES.name: Advanced Printmaking
COURSES.description: Advanced problems in creative printmaking.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3 to 6; can be repeated with change in content; Prereq: ART 3442C, ART 3420C and ART 3443C.

COURSES.name: Advanced Painting
COURSES.description: Emphasizes individual creative expression.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 6; can be repeated with change in content. Prereq: ART 3522C, ART 3560C and ART 3561C.

COURSES.name: Digital Media Workshop
COURSES.description: Bridges the study of digital media and broadly envisioned professional practices in the field. Emphasis on portfolio and project development for transition to advanced study or professional, expressive or applied practices in integrated media.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: DIG 4527C and DIG 4528C.

COURSES.name: Digital Fabrication
COURSES.description: Interdisciplinary studio combines in-depth analysis of the role of the physical object in diverse conceptual art practices with project-based experimentation using rapid prototyping and manufacturing technologies.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3: Prereq: DIG 2131, SAAH junior or senior, or instructor permission.

COURSES.name: Sensors and Electronics-Based Art
COURSES.description: Physical computing HCI (human computer interaction) explores how devices respond to and interact with human physical action. Students will create artwork that explores physical interfaces beyond mouse/keyboard/screen interactions through the use of microcontrollers and sensors.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 3133C, junior-level digital media major and/or instructor permission.

COURSES.name: Advanced Sculpture
COURSES.description: Advanced problems in sculptural form with development of processes and techniques.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 3711C and ART 3712C.

COURSES.name: Advanced Ceramics
COURSES.description: Focuses on advanced technical and creative concepts with emphasis on developing personal work and professional practices preparation.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3 to 6; can be repeated with change in content (Majors - 6 credits; Elective - 3 or 6 credits); Prereq: ART 3762C, ART 3764C, ART 3768C and ART 3784C.

COURSES.name: Making and Meaning
COURSES.description: Explores the creation of art in combination with non-art related research. Develop a deeper connection with created artwork and discover how the act of making can reveal both intentions and underlying motives.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: junior or senior-level School of Art and Art History major.
